attributes.action: Create a £1 per square foot per year service charge to pay for public transport
attributes.additional_details: It should fall on both residential and commercial property. In future, more valuable properties may have to pay a higher service charge than less valuable properties. It may be worth reading the book Progress and Poverty by Henry George.
attributes.background: I believe that since nobody created the land, it's only fair that it's taxed. It may not appeal to landlords, but we don't have to ask them. A £1 per square foot charge can contribute significantly towards improving public transport, as well as reducing strikes and the cost to consumers.

rejection.details:
